results.title: Romeo and Juliet (Luhrmann) (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Baz Luhrmann, Gabriella Martinelli, Jill Bilcock, Bazmark and Catherine Martin
results.brief_description: Baz Luhrmann, director of “Strictly Ballroom” tells the greatest love story of all time in our time. William Shakespeare’s classic tale of star-crossed lovers is set in Verona Beach; a violent modern city of guns, money and greed. In this opulent world of hate, rival gangs, and families at war Romeo and Juliet are ignited by the passion of forbidden first love and Verona Beach explodes. Shakespeare’s heart wrenching tale of doomed love is told with passion, beauty, wit and furious energy. It’s a film that will kick you in the heart.

results.title: Culloden
results.brief_description: A dramatic reconstruction of the Battle of Culloden, fought in 1746 between the Scottish Jacobites and an English force led by the Duke of Cumberland. In this film, the director utilises a television reportage style to recreate and analyse the battle.

results.title: Herbie rides again
results.creator_credit: Robert Stevenson, Bill Walsh and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Another adventure with the VW with a mind of its own; Herbie. In this escapade Herbie comes to the assistance of a little old lady. They combine their efforts to stop a tycoon from building the world’s highest building on her property. Starring Helen Hayes, Ken Berry, Stefanie Powers, John McIntire and Keenan Wynn. Based on a story by Gordon Buford, screenplay by Bill Walsh.

results.title: For the love of Benji
results.creator_credit: Joe Camp, Ben Vaughn and Mulberry Square
results.brief_description: In this sequel to the popular family movie “Benji”, our furry friend is in store for more heart stopping adventures. When holidaying in Greece with ladyfriend Tiffany and his newly adopted family, Benji and his friend are off to a bad start when they become embroiled in an international spy ring. Starring Cynthia Smith, Allen Fiuzat, Patsy Garrett and Ed Nelson.

results.title: Japan in winter
results.brief_description: Japan in winter is a busy time of the year with preparations for the celebration of the New Year (Japan’s equivalent of Christmas time). This is the time when the most colorful festivals take place all over the country and the people make great preparations for the ceremonies. On New Year’s Day the shrines and streets are crowded as millions of Japanese take part in winter celebrations.

results.title: Stromboli
results.creator_credit: Roberto Rossellini and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Ingrid Bergman plays Karin, a World War II refugee who marries and Italian fisherman to escape a displaced persons camp. As they set off for his home, the Meditteranean island of Stromboli, her head is filled with romantic notions of an idyllic paradise. When they arrive, however, her dreams are immediately shattered as she is faced with a desolate, barren landscape and the dominating presence of a threatening volcano. The atmosphere from other women in the village also adds to her depression, as they make it clear that her immodesty disgusts them. Filled with unforgettable images and a fishing scene that ranks as one of cinema’s greatest.

results.title: Dunderklumpen
results.creator_credit: Paulette Rubinstein, Lynn Manwaring and G G Communications
results.brief_description: A magical trip into fantasyland, with Dunderklumpen and his mysterious friends who appear on a night filled with magic. Features a mixture of animation and real characters. Based on the original Swedish version, produced by Gunnar Karisson and directed by Per Ahlin. This American version is dubbed into English.

results.title: Captain James Cook
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Collings, Bern Gandy and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Retraces the voyages of Captain Cook along the east coast of Australia from Mallacoota Inlet to Cape York, and contrasts Cook’s comments with the developments that have since taken place. Gabo island, Botany Bay, Brisgane, Bustard Bay and Rockhampton, Magnetic Island, Cape Tribulation, the Endeavour River and the present Cooktown. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Gettysburg
results.creator_credit: Ronald F Maxwell, Moctesuma Esparza, Robert Katz and Turner Pictures
results.brief_description: The American Civil War raged for nearly four years and cost over 642,000 men their lives. In a single battle, during three days of brutal combat in the town of gettysburg, nearly 50,000 soldiers were killed - more than during all the years of the Vietnam War. Though it recounts one of the bloodiest chapters in history, this film is about more than just statistics - it is the story of ordinary men caught in an extraordinary battle to fight for their beliefs and freedom. An all star cast headed by Martin Sheen, Tom Berenger, Jeff Daniels and Sam Elliot bring these remarkable characters to life in a thrilling epic that captures powerful emotions and showcases some of the most awesome action sequences ever filmed!

results.title: Othello
results.creator_credit: Oliver Parker, David Barron, Luc Roeg, Dakota Films and Imminent Films
results.brief_description: Othello: an intoxicating mix of love, sexual passion and the deadly power of jealousy. Riddled with jealousy and twisted with racial hatred, Iago (Kenneth Branagh) schemes and plots his way to torturing the love of Othello (Laurence Fishburne) and Desdemona (Irene Jacob). In a visually stunning and superbly acted masterpiece, Othello tells the most passionate tale of love and betrayal of all time.
